An intern leaked half the bits of the RSA private key. Can you decrypt the secret message and prove their mistake was critical? Ciphertext: 1715106791087827987000972619073830728009049624997906797281602336492309835956280939452904560203347534006372386990878330117716107278488258330214705523749175

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5895823893185236343834706667198826331188503959721028748349438700245163380734231718571638569887280687371339702023709447059897292130784392847882886011539487, e=5334830999806025804485569412591546588563834944533554631826180141173693839202788360741723156881978578970133838368476556921661053822042990601605419752741935, partial_p=12212016726542067371

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{2wfwaog6}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1715106791087827987000972619073830728009049624997906797281602336492309835956280939452904560203347534006372386990878330117716107278488258330214705523749175
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5895823893185236343834706667198826331188503959721028748349438700245163380734231718571638569887280687371339702023709447059897292130784392847882886011539487, e=5334830999806025804485569412591546588563834944533554631826180141173693839202788360741723156881978578970133838368476556921661053822042990601605419752741935, partial_p=12212016726542067371
extra_info: p=76656071386748383606751261759142341523052757422589859877552934297451451133729, q=76912680059474762957387061916564218046117214434388969636193406122942138832703, Ï†(n)=5895823893185236343834706667198826331188503959721028748349438700245163380734078149820192346740716549047663995464140277088040313301270646507462492421573056
